sentences: Ma olen paari nädala eest olnud haige.
Ta on paari aasta jooksul kaotanud palju kaalu.
Meil on veel paari päeva aega ettevalmistumiseks.
context: The Estonian word 'paari' is the partitive case form of ' paar', which means 'pair'. In this usage, it functions as an indefinite quantifier meaning 'a few' or 'several' when referring to a small number of items, time periods, or other countable nouns. It's commonly used with genitive plurals to express a quantity that is more than one but not many.
